column4: hey all, i rebooted but now that its rebooted it says "BusyBox v1.1.3 (debian1:1.1.3-5ubuntu12) Built in shell (ash) Enter 'help' for a list of built0in commans
any idea why this has happened
are you using Hardy or Intrepid
and what motherboard/chipset do you have ?
have any linux distributions been run successfully on it or is this your first try.  or have others failed?
i have been happily and sucessfully running hardy until i rebooted
if you have other kernels listed in the boot menu can you see if these older ones work?
nope, same error with older releases
i am not sure what to say but if you recently had disk corruption of some kind, that could be it.  it doesn't work if you goto recovery mode?  do you use any kind of RAID?
i assume if you tried a livecd  right now it would boot just fine?
hmm the program is called fsck but i am not sure that you can execute it from there
the only solution i can see is to reinstall, i am not sure what the cause is
